items.label: Fluentis Installer Service on Linux Docker
Fluentis Live Update on Windows Server

docker-installation/getting-started.title: Overview
docker-installation/getting-started.description: In this section we will cover a variety of topics: from installing Docker Engine (also known as Docker Community Edition) on Ubuntu or Docker Desktop on Windows, to pulling images from the Fluentis Docker Repository and starting and managing containers.

docker-installation/windows/docker-deskt.title: Docker Desktop Install
docker-installation/windows/docker-deskt.description: This installation is intented to be used only for demo purposes.

fluentis-on-docker/getting-started.description: In this section we will cover Fluentis installation in Docker environment

fluentis/clients-installation/fluentis-w.title: Fluentis Web Client Installation
fluentis/clients-installation/fluentis-w.description: You can run Fluentis Web by different Operative Systems such as: MacOs, Linux Distros, Microsoft Windows.

fluentis/clients-installation/fluentis-x.title: Fluentis Mobile Client Installation
fluentis/clients-installation/fluentis-x.description: You can run Fluentis Mobile in Android

fluentis/docker/fluentis-docker-installa.title: Fluentis on Docker
fluentis/docker/fluentis-docker-installa.description: This article will describe how to manage the Fluentis/ARM installation, assuming that the article FluentisLiveUpdate Installation has been followed, and so FluentisLiveUpdate web app is up and running.

fluentis/getting-started.title: Overview
fluentis/getting-started.description: In this section we will cover Fluentis installation in Standard and Docker environment.

fluentis/web/web-installation.title: Fluentis Web Installation
fluentis/web/web-installation.description: Fluentis 2023 is available in a Web version through the use of the Blazor framework.

fluentis/windows/fluentis-standard-insta.title: Fluentis on Windows
fluentis/windows/fluentis-standard-insta.description: This article will describe how to manage the Fluentis/ARM installation, assuming that the article FluentisLiveUpdate Installation has been followed, and so FluentisLiveUpdate web app is up and running.

fluentisinstaller/getting-started.title: Overview
fluentisinstaller/getting-started.description: Fluentis Live Update is the management tool for Fluentis installations and updates.

fluentisinstaller/linux/fluentisinstalle.title: Fluentis Installer Service on Linux Docker
fluentisinstaller/linux/fluentisinstalle.description: In Linux environments with Docker, it is necessary to first install the FluentisInstallerService and then FluentisLiveUpdate.

fluentisinstaller/windows/fluentisinstal.title: Fluentis Live Update on Windows Server
fluentisinstaller/windows/fluentisinstal.description: In the Windows Server environment, installation of the Fluentis Installer Service and the Fluentis Live Update Web application with its database is done contextually.

fluentisliveupdate/docker/flu-docker-ins.title: Fluentis Live Update on Docker
fluentisliveupdate/docker/flu-docker-ins.description: In this article is described step by step the installation of FluentisLiveUpdate on Docker.

fluentisliveupdate/docker/flu-docker-upd.description: Start by downloading the bash script:

fluentisliveupdate/menu/docker-installat.title: Docker Installations
fluentisliveupdate/menu/docker-installat.description: In this page are listed all the active/current Docker Installations. To create a new one, add a row with server name, installation path on the server and the folder name where Fluentis should be installed. After inserting the request data, save it with the green floppy icon, placed on the top right corner of the page.

fluentisliveupdate/menu/environments.title: Environments
fluentisliveupdate/menu/environments.description: In this page there are all the Fluentis and ARM installations. At first the page will show all the ARM servers and databases, then for each arm server all the related fluentis cluster and finally for each cluster all the releated databases.

fluentisliveupdate/menu/installer-servic.title: Installer Services
fluentisliveupdate/menu/installer-servic.description: In this page are listed all the active/current Fluentis Installers registrations. For each installer there is server with which it can communicate.

fluentisliveupdate/menu/licenses.title: Licenses
fluentisliveupdate/menu/licenses.description: In this page you can insert a Fluentis License that will be put directly in the database when you install an environment.

fluentisliveupdate/menu/repository.title: Repository
fluentisliveupdate/menu/repository.description: You MUST Give the 777 Permission to Repository Target Folder

fluentisliveupdate/menu/settings.title: Settings
fluentisliveupdate/menu/settings.description: In this page you can change FluentisLiveUpdate settings. Only a few parameters can be changed frequently, that are:

intro.title: FluentisLiveUpdate
intro.description: This guide explains how to install the fluentis suite, which consists of Fluentis Live Update, Application Resource Manager, and Fluentis Erp.

os-installation/softwareRequirements.description: The purpose of this guide is to illustrate the steps related to the installation of Ubuntu server and Photon OS.

os-installation/ubuntu-server/ubuntu-ser.title: Ubuntu Installation
os-installation/ubuntu-server/ubuntu-ser.description: Use always a Long Term Support (LTS) release of Ubuntu Server. They are 'enterprise grade' releases that are supported for 5 years at no cost. See The Ubuntu lifecycle and release cadence for more information.

os-installation/ubuntu-server/ubuntu-ser.title: Ubuntu Post Installation
os-installation/ubuntu-server/ubuntu-ser.description: Optional - Disable sudo prompt for password

particular-cases/linux-docker/ftp.title: FTP installation
particular-cases/linux-docker/ftp.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard communication protocol used for the transfer of computer files from a server to a client on a computer network.

particular-cases/linux-docker/ufw.title: UFW - Uncomplicated Firewall
particular-cases/linux-docker/ufw.description: The default firewall configuration tool for Ubuntu is ufw.

specifications/client/client-specificati.title: Windows
specifications/client/client-specificati.description: In order to take full advantage of the potential made available by the new Fluentis 2021, the client machine must also guarantee a minimum of hardware resources, to allow optimal visualization and rapid data loading.

specifications/Fluentis Web/specificatio.title: FluentisWeb Server Requirements
specifications/Fluentis Web/specificatio.description: The Web version is available exclusively for Fluentis, not for Application Resource Manager

specifications/FluentisMobile/specificat.title: Fluentis Mobile Client Requirements
specifications/FluentisMobile/specificat.description: the mobile version is  is currently only available for Android and not for iOS

specifications/getting-started.title: Overview

sql-server-installation/Delete on docker.title: Delete Database Backup from Docker Container
sql-server-installation/Delete on docker.description: If you need to delete a backup file (.bak) from a database inside a Docker container, you'll have to enter the container with administrator privileges.

sql-server-installation/docker/sql-serve.title: MSSQL On Docker (Multiple Instances)
sql-server-installation/docker/sql-serve.description: You can drive multiple instances of MSSQL through a docker engine in a Linux distribution-based server.
